value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">2</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">common voice singing out of doors, He has no house. He <choice>
            <sic>l ves</sic>
            <corr>lives</corr>
          </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a <choice>
            <sic>r ming</sic>
            <corr>roaming</corr>
          </choice> life crossing the fields, mounting the hills,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lying under the hawthown to listen to the <choice>
            <sic>nightigale</sic>
            <corr>nightingale</corr>
          </choice>.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">By shutting out a chimney or a factory we can still</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">see what <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> saw-- the bird haunted reed whispering fen,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the down and the green scar<del>e</del> never quite <add place="above">not yet</add> healed along which</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he came when he made his journeys. He was a simple singer,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lifting a song or a story from other peoples lips and <choice>
            <sic>lettig</sic>
            <corr>letting</corr>
          </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the audience join in the chorus. <choice>
            <sic>Somemimes</sic>
            <corr>Sometimes</corr>
          </choice> he made a few lines</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that exactly matched his emotion--</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but there is no <add place="above">name</add> <choice>
            <sic>mae</sic>
            <corr>name</corr>
          </choice> to that song.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Then when the houses had come together in some</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><choice>
            <sic>lcearing</sic>
            <corr>clearing</corr>
          </choice> in a ring and roads, often flooded, often deep in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mud, led from hxxxx the cottage to the Manor, from the Manor</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the Church in the middle, along the roads came <choice>
            <sic>minstersl</sic>
            <corr>minstrels</corr>
          </choice> <add hand="ms" place="inline">came</add></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">jugglers, bear leaders, singing their songs at the back door</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to the farm hands and the maid servants in the uncouth</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">jargon of their native tongue.</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>Icham for woing al forwake</l>
            <l>Wery no water in wore</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Up stairs they spoke French. Anons words were as</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">uncouth to the master and mistress as to us. Anon</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">singing at <choice>
            <sic>yhe</sic>
            <corr>the</corr>
          </choice> back door was  <choice>
            <sic>despsied</sic>
            <corr>despised</corr>
          </choice>. He had no name;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">he had no place, yet even if they felt contempt for the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><add place="above">singer whose body took its [small?] part in the [dance?]</add> man who made songs, they tolerated him. Even Kings and Queens</l>
